message: Hello Bob, I have a unique opportunity for you to acquire a high-value product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $14,000. This is a competitive price considering the product's worth to you.

Alice, thanks for the offer, but $14,000 is a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to pay $8,000 for the product.  That's my absolute maximum, and I'm confident it's a fair price considering your value for it.
I understand your constraints, Bob, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get at least $11,000 for the product. Can we discuss a price of $11,500?

Alice, I appreciate you being willing to negotiate. However, $11,500 is still out of my price range. I'm prepared to pay $9,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair compromise, considering your value for the product and my maximum budget.

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $11,000. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'll meet you at $10,500. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $10,500 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $9,500.  This is my final offer, and I hope we can reach an agreement.

I'm not willing to go below $11,000, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $10,000, but that's as low as I can go. I'm starting to think we're not going to reach an agreement, and I'll have to consider other options.
